summary: This document is a call summary from May 26, 2023, between an unnamed party and attorney Jeanne Christensen of Wigdor LLP. It details allegations from a victim who claims she was trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein and violently raped by Leon Black at Epstein's New York townhouse around 2001-2002 when she was 16. The summary includes descriptions of the abuse, the victim's background, and her subsequent interactions with law enforcement.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Described as a Wall Street person, founder of a major private equity fund, and a friend of Jeffrey Epstein. He is accused of violently raping a 16-year-old victim at Epstein's townhouse around 2001-2002.

persons.name: Jeanne Christensen
persons.context: Attorney with Wigdor LLP who previously represented the victim in a civil defamation case (not a sex abuse case) and is the subject of the call summary.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a friend of Leon Black who preyed on the victim, trafficked her, and discussed her with Black. The victim was brought to his Manhattan townhouse.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as handing the victim off to Epstein and having the victim sleep in their bed. The victim viewed her as a mother figure but also as mean.

connections.description: Described as friends. Epstein referred to Black as his 'special friend' and they discussed the victim.
Worked together in trafficking the victim; Maxwell handed the victim off to Epstein.
Black is accused of violently raping the 16-year-old victim at Epstein's townhouse.
Epstein preyed on, trafficked, and abused the victim from 2001 to 2004.
Christensen previously represented the victim in a civil defamation case.

events.title: Alleged Rape of Victim by Leon Black
events.description: The victim alleges she was violently raped by Leon Black at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse when she was 16 years old. The assault involved severe pain, bleeding, and the use of adult sex toys.

events.title: Victim Trafficking Period
events.description: The victim states she was trafficked by an unnamed individual and had sex with at least 25 different men during this period, facilitated by Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Victim Contact with USAO
events.description: The victim went to the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO) in Manhattan in May or June 2021 to report the allegations.

events.title: US Virgin Islands Investigation Interviews
events.description: In late 2020 and early 2021, officials in the US Virgin Islands were trying to interview underage girls who had been on the island; the victim participated in around two meetings with a lawyer.

events.title: Call Summary Created
events.description: A call summary was created documenting a conversation with attorney Jeanne Christensen regarding the victim's allegations against Leon Black.

keyFacts: A victim alleges she was 16 when Leon Black violently raped her at Jeffrey Epstein's New York townhouse around 2001-2002, causing rectal bleeding.
The victim was trafficked from 2001 to 2004, during which she was forced to have sex with at least 25 different men facilitated by Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
After the alleged rape, Black and others at Epstein's house flew the victim out of New York the next day instead of taking her to a doctor.
The victim reported the allegations to the U.S. Attorney's Office in Manhattan in May or June 2021.
The document notes the victim has medical records showing trauma from sexual abuse, including rectal tearing.
